result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron John Moore

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Satorius. kma

01:02 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius and Intern Kaitlin Dippolito, DF:  Aaron John Moore appeared. INCLUDES 21CM689 (PLEAS), 22CM36 (PLEAS), 22CM38 (PLEAS) and 21CF582 (SEH). Atty. Dippolito recites agreement, sentencing hearing regarding revocation on DJOC in 21CF582. Counsel to file jail credit in 7 days. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier in 21CM689 and Ct 5 - Bail Jumping - Misd in 22CM38. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier in 21CM689 and Ct 5 - Bail Jumping - Misd in 22CM38. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in Ct 2 in 21CM689, Cts 1-4 in 22CM38 and case 22CM36. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 

Court orders:
21CF582
Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail time - STAYED
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at the discretion of Agent
- Particpate in Victim Empathy Panel through Restorative Justice
- Complete domestic violence assessment and follow any recommendations
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommendations
- No abusive contact with Heather W.
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100; payable through Clerk of Court

21CM689
Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct WITH modifier
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:

- Maintain absolute sobriety

- Particpate in Victim Empathy Panel through Restorative Justice
- Complete domestic violence assessment and follow any recommendations
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommendations
- No abusive contact with Heather W.
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100; payable through Clerk of Court

22CM38
Ct 5 - Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days conditional jail time - STAYED
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Random testing at the discretion of Agent
- Particpate in Victim Empathy Panel through Restorative Justice
- Complete domestic violence assessment and follow any recommendations
- Complete mental health assessment and follow any recommendations
- No abusive contact with Heather W.
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Any bond on file to be refunded to payor, payment plan approved. 
Defendant to report to probation no later than 4:00 PM today, 5/13/22.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:12 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius and Intern Kaitlin Dippolito,  DF: Aaron John Moore appeared. INCLUDES 21CF582 ( Set for SEH), 21CM689 (Set for PLEAS), 22CM36 (Set for PLEAS) and 22CM38 (Set for PLEAS). ADA Ballo recites agreement. DE sworn. DE requests to reset today's hearing for clarification regarding plea. Court resets all matters. Adjourned. kma Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Includes 21CF582, 21CM689, 22CM36 and 22CM38.

11:31 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: S. Fox, DA: Karl Anderson, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius, DF:  Aaron John Moore appeared.  Includes 21CF582, 21CM689, 22CM36 and 22CM38. There is a resolution. Atty Anderson requests a plea in 30 days to allow Mr. Moore time to complete services. Victim requests to address No Contact. Court does not amend bond for today. Court to reconsider bond amendment after receipt of assessments.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
for bond modification. Filed by Victim. Requesting No contact be removed. arc    SJN DENIED bond modification at this time.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on March 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:31 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Holly Rockow, DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius, DF:  Aaron John Moore appeared. INCLUDES 21CM689, 21CF582, 22CM36 and 22CM38. Atty. Satorius states that there is a possible global resolution. Court sets additional PSC. Atty. Satorius notes bond modification request filed by Victim. ADA Rockow objects to bond modification. Atty. Satorius makes bond argument, DE is enrolled in parenting classes. Court denies bond modification at this time. Adjourned: 3:43 PM. kma  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Satorius. km

Scheduling conference on March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on March 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Includes 22CM36 and 22CM38.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Heather W. or her residence EXCEPT for electronic communications (text or email) regarding childcare ONLY.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from residence in presence of law enforcement ONE TIME ONLY.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, John M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:05 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Tavis Satorius and Kaitlin Dippolito for today  DF:  Aaron John Moore appeared from jail by video means. Includes 22CM36 and 22CM38. DE does qualify for PD. Court advises of charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SC with DA and PSC.
